alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 4:23AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A FEW POCKETS OF FREEZING RAIN ARE POSSIBLE IN RURAL PORTIONS OF EASTERN BROOME AND SUSQUEHANNA COUNTIES THIS MORNING... While temperatures across the area are generally a few degrees above freezing, a few icy patches may exist in cooler valleys and hollows in rural parts of eastern Broome and Susquehanna Counties. The most likely areas would be on rural back roads east of the I-81 corridor. Slow down and be cautious especially on bridges if you are headed out early this morning. If traveling east, keep in mind worse conditions exist, particularly in the Catskills and Poconos, where Winter Weather Advisories remain in effect.
